ImageData.LabelName: b Spread to other parts of the body

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Added lines from the distant lymph nodes label pointing to the lymph nodes in the neck
Updated skin tone to FP IV; changed the figure in the inset to an older American Indian/Alaskan Native male
Labeled the Left and Right adrenal glands; In inset, showed lymph nodes in the neck area, and labeled them “Distant lymph nodes”
Made lymph nodes smaller, "normal size", in main figure
Added the labels "Left kidney" to main figure and "Adrenal gland" to inset
Removed cancer from the lymph nodes

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IV kidney cancer; drawing shows cancer that has spread beyond the layer of fatty tissue around the left kidney to a) the adrenal gland above the left kidney. Also shown are the lymph nodes, right adrenal gland, and right kidney. An inset shows b) other parts of the body where kidney cancer may spread, including the brain, lung, liver, adrenal gland, bone, and distant lymph nodes.

Stage IV kidney cancer; drawing shows cancer that has spread beyond the layer of fatty tissue around the left kidney to a) the adrenal gland above the left kidney. Also shown are the lymph nodes, right adrenal gland, and right kidney. An inset shows b) other parts of the body where kidney cancer may spread, including the brain, lung, liver, adrenal gland, bone, and distant lymph nodes.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IV kidney cancer. Cancer has spread a) beyond the layer of fatty tissue around the kidney and may have spread into the adrenal gland above the kidney with cancer or to nearby lymph nodes, or b) to other parts of the body, such as the brain, lung, liver, adrenal gland, bone, or distant lymph nodes.

Stage IV kidney cancer. Cancer has spread a) beyond the layer of fatty tissue around the kidney and may have spread into the adrenal gland above the kidney with cancer or to nearby lymph nodes, or b) to other parts of the body, such as the brain, lung, liver, adrenal gland, bone, or distant lymph nodes.
